bibl.title: Letter from George B. Cortelyou to Elihu Root, May 26, 1902

div1.p: Cortelyou sends endorsements from the President concerning Reed succeeding Sternberg as the Surgeon General. The President also mentions O'Reilly. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from George B. Cortelyou to Elihu Root, May 26, 1902
div1.opener:
Personal.
RECEIVED
MAY 28 1902
OFFICE
Secretary of War.
WHITE HOUSE,
WASHINGTON.
May 26, 1902.
My dear Sir:
div1.p:
By direction of the President I beg to send you
for your consideration the enclosed communication
signed by the members of the Faculty of Medicine of
Harvard University, in behalf of Dr. Walter Reed,
whom they recommend for Surgeon General of the Army
to succeed Dr. Sternberg when he shall have retired.

The President wishes me to say that he also
hears well of Colonel O'Reilly.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Geo. B. Cortelyou
Secretary to the President. Hon. Elihu Root,
Secretary of War.
Enclosure.
